Posts.Content: Jul 21, 2016 11:02PM Deb_B wrote: Thank you. I had left my instructions in the car. My husband finally got home, got the papers out of the car and we called. I have to keep the compression wrap (ace bands) on because I have a bleeding disorder but she had him rewrap me. The bands were pulling on the steri strips. I have A LOT less pain now. Thank God.
Posts.Title: Help please I had 3 Stereotactic vacuum biopsies today Deb_B Deb_B

Posts.Content: Deb_B wrote: They wrapped me TIGHTLY in ace bandages and I think they are making my breasts hurt worse. I am supposed to stay in them for 48 hours. I swear my breast are touching my bottom lip. lol Anyone else have this? I have a very high pain threshold and this hurts like heck. Tylenol is like candy. No effect at all. I wonder if a compression sports bra would work just as well without the added pain? I've read how everyone was able to go about their day afterwards and some even went back to work. I didn't expect this. -Deb Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Help please I had 3 Stereotactic vacuum biopsies today Deb_B Deb_B

Posts.Content: Jul 17, 2016 07:58AM - edited Jul 17, 2016 12:17PM by Deb_B Great. Thank you ladies. I'll be driving myself. They told me I would be wrapped up in ace bandages for 48 hours. I'm in Texas. Thank God for air conditioning. :)
Posts.Title: Stereotactic biopsy - Drive myself Deb_B

Posts.Content: Deb_B wrote: I have a question for those of you who have been through these biopsies. Were you able to drive yourself to and from the biopsy? I am having 3 done in one day and wondering if I should have my husband drive me home. How did you feel afterwards and was driving difficult? Thanks in advance, Debra Log in to post a reply
